Producers¶

Producers come in three types: PrimaryProducer, SecondaryProducer and OnDemandProducer

PrimaryProducer¶

class rgma.PrimaryProducer(storage, supportedQueries)¶

Bases: rgma.Producer

A primary producer publishes information into R-GMA.

Parameters:
  • storage (rgma.Storage) – a storage object to define the type and, if permanent, the name of the storage to be used
  • supportedQueries (rgma.SupportedQueries) – a supported queries object to define what query types the producer will be able to support.
declareTable(name, predicate, historyRetentionPeriod, latestRetentionPeriod)¶
Parameters:
  • name (string) – the name of the table to declare
  • predicate (string) – an SQL WHERE clause defining the subset of a table that this producer will publish. To publish to the whole table, an empty predicate can be used.
  • historyRetentionPeriod (rgma.TimeInterval) – the history retention period for this table
  • latestRetentionPeriod (rgma.TimeInterval) – the default latest retention period for tuples inserted into this table. It can be overridden when inserting tuples.
insert(insertStatement, latestRetentionPeriod=None)¶

Publishes a single tuple or a list of tuples into a table.

Parameters:
  • insertStatement (string or [str]) – a string or list of strings representing a SQL INSERT statement providing the data to publish and the table into which to put it
  • latestRetentionPeriod (rgma.TimeInterval) – latest retention period for this tuple or tuples (overrides LRP defined for table)

SecondaryProducer¶

class rgma.SecondaryProducer(storage, supportedQueries)¶

Bases: rgma.Producer

Republish information from other producers.

Parameters:
  • storage (rgma.Storage) – a storage object to define the type and, if permanent, the name of the storage to be used
  • supportedQueries (rgma.SupportedQueries) – a supported queries object to define what query types the producer will be able to support.
declareTable(name, predicate, historyRetentionPeriod)¶
Parameters:
  • name (string) – the name of the table to declare
  • predicate (string) – an SQL WHERE clause defining the subset of a table that this producer will publish. To publish to the whole table, an empty predicate can be used.
  • historyRetentionPeriod (rgma.TimeInterval) – the history retention period for this table
  • latestRetentionPeriod (rgma.TimeInterval) – the default latest retention period for tuples inserted into this table. It can be overridden when inserting tuples.
getResourceId()¶

Return the resouceId to be used as the argument to subsequent static showSignOfLife calls.

Returns:the resourceId as an int
showSignOfLife()¶
Contacts the secondary producer resource to check that it is still alive and prevent it from being timed out.
static staticClose(resourceId)¶

Contacts the secondary producer resource to close it.

Parameter:resourceId (int) – the identifier of the resource to be checked
static staticShowSignOfLife(resourceId)¶

Contacts the secondary producer resource to check that it is still alive and prevent it from being timed out.

Parameter:resourceId (int) – the identifier of the resource to be checked
Returns:bool True if resource is still alive otherwise False

OnDemandProducer¶

class rgma.OnDemandProducer(hostName, port)¶

Bases: rgma.Producer

A client uses an on-demand producer to publish data into R-GMA when the cost of creating each message is high. The on-demand producer only generates messages when there is a specific query from a consumer.

Parameters:
  • hostName (string) – the host name of the system that will respond to queries
  • port (integer) – the port on the specified host that will respond to queries
declareTable(name, predicate)¶
Parameters:
  • name (string) – the name of the table to declare
  • predicate (string) – an SQL WHERE clause defining the subset of a table that this producer will publish. To publish to the whole table, an empty predicate can be used.

Storage¶

class rgma.Storage¶

Storage location for tuples.

static getDatabaseStorage()¶

Gets a database storage object. If no logical name is given the storage cannot be reused.

Returns:a database rgma.Storage object
static getMemoryStorage()¶

Gets a temporary memory storage object. This storage cannot be reused.

Returns:a temporary memory rgma.Storage object

SupportedQueries¶

class rgma.SupportedQueries¶

Types of query supported by a primary or secondary producer - each represented by a class variable.

C¶

Continuous queries only.

CH¶

Continuous and history queries.

CL¶

Continuous and latest queries.

CHL¶

Continuous, History and Latest queries.

Producer¶

class rgma.Producer¶

Bases: rgma.Resource

A producer.

getResourceEndpoint()¶

Return the resource endpoint to be used in the constructor of a consumer to make a “directed query”.

Returns:rgma.ResourceEndpoint
